ml.alternet.parser

Class Grammar.Token

  • java.lang.Object
    • ml.alternet.parser.Grammar.Rule
      • ml.alternet.parser.Grammar.Token
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Cloneable, Presentable, HasWhitespacePolicy, TraversableRule
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Grammar.CharToken, Grammar.EnumToken, Grammar.EnumValueToken, Grammar.GrammarToken, Grammar.Number, Grammar.Skip, Grammar.StringToken, Grammar.TypedToken

    Grammar

    public abstract static class Grammar.Token
extends Grammar.Rule
implements HasWhitespacePolicy
    When parsing, a token yield a EventsHandler.TokenValue.
    Author:
    Philippe Poulard

      • unwrap

        public Grammar.CharToken unwrap()
        Return the underlying char token if any ; useful for combining it.
        Returns:
        This token if it is a char token, or the wrapped token if it is a char token.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - It this token is not a char token or doesn't wrap a char token.
        See Also:
        Grammar.CharToken.union(CharRange...), CharToken#union(Token...), Grammar.CharToken.except(CharRange...), CharToken#except(Token...), TraversableRule.SimpleRule, CharToken#unwrap(Token)

      • traverse

        public Grammar.Rule traverse(Grammar.Rule hostRule,
                             Set<Grammar.Rule> traversed,
                             BiFunction<Grammar.Rule,Grammar.Rule,Grammar.Rule> transformer,
                             Function<Grammar.Rule,Grammar.Rule> targetRule)
        Description copied from interface: TraversableRule
        Traverse this rule and apply a transformer on each subrules, that is to say recursively apply the function to the rules that are composing this rule, otherwise do nothing ; if the function change a rule, it must be replaced by the new one. The changes can be applied to this rule or on a clone according to a supplier.

        Implementation details

        A concrete rule has to implement this method, to allow visiting its internals. The idea is to traverse a rule once, by applying a specific task (performed by a transformer) on its components rules, and then to recursively traverse the result. If necessary, the transformation may be applied on itself or a clone, according to the targetRule supplier. Sometimes rules are composed of just another rule, such as Grammar.Optional, or by several rules, such as Grammar.Choice ; you can examine the code of the relevant classes, respectively TraversableRule.SimpleRule and TraversableRule.CombinedRule that traverse a single nested rule or a list of nested rules.
        Specified by:
        traverse in interface TraversableRule
        Parameters:
        hostRule - The host rule in the hierarchy that is declared as a field in a grammar, that is to say that has a name.
        traversed - Each time a rule is traversed, it must be stored in this set to avoid traversing it again during recursion.
        transformer - (hostRule, subRule) -> transformedRule The function that transform a subrule, must return that argument to keep it unchanged. The hostRule is the nearest enclosing rule that has a name (that is to say which is a grammar field).
        targetRule - (thisRule) -> sameRuleOrClone Supply the rule on which the changes have to be applied : typically the rule itself or a clone of it. The argument of this function is this rule.
        Returns:
        The rule on which the changes were performed, given by the targetRule (this rule or a clone of this rule), or this rule if no changed were performed. The resulting rule must be of the same type of the original.
